content.webTitle: Tom Varndell scores twice as England Saxons ease past Russia

fields.headline: Tom Varndell scores twice as England Saxons ease past Russia
fields.bodyText: The Wasps wing Tom Varndell ran in two tries as England Saxons began their Churchill Cup campaign with a seven-try 49-17 victory over Russia in Denver. Tries from the flanker Andy Saull, the full-back Nick Abendanon, No8 Luke Narraway and Varndell, all converted by the fly-half Stephen Myler, put the Saxons in a dominant position. But Russia, who have qualified for next year's World Cup, battled bravely and three penalties from Yury Kushnarev and a well-taken try from wing Vasily Artemiev saw them trail 28-14 at the break. The fly-half Kushnarev added another penalty for the Russians but further tries from Varndell, Micky Young and Stephen Myler, who ended with 19 points to his name, completed a comfortable victory.
